subject: Fix wrong check with locations in api v2

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

Hi 

In v2, locations is a reserved image property. You need to add a location to an image using the PATCH method. Please refer http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-image-v2.html#updateImage-v2. You can also use the cli, in which case that would be glance --os-image-api-version 2 add-location --url <url> <image>. I hope you understand there is no need for this patch. Please ping us on IRC or Mailinglist, if you need more info.

Thanks
Sabari

Patch Set 8:

Hi Sabari:
I know there is an update Api. But if we can't creat a image with locations directly. Why we need to get and check it in the def:
https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/location.py#L135. 
We can directly refuse the locations in RequestDeserializer.

In: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L799.
_image_locations_set is a general func both in create and update. Why not put it under 'if image_id:'?

And in doc : http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-image-v2.html#createImage-v2, we can see :
"With correct permissions, you can see the image status as active through API calls if you created the image with Location header."

From the informations above, I think glance maybe support create image with location directly in Api V2. Maybe it doesn't support actually,
so I need your help.

I test the command 'location-add'. It return an error in glance-client:
The administrator has disabled API access to image locations (HTTP 400).
It because that there is no location key in image information when client try to get it.
But it's ok to use curl.
Is there a CONF to set that? or it's a bug?

Thanks very much.
